. By yo
r
last dispatch, her
Ma
ty
is referred untyll fur-
ther
ceeding uppon the
States
further consultation
and therfore I can for
e present send you no
other Resolution or dyrection. This l
re
ther-
fore must serve only to advertise you of
e receipt, and also to dischardg part of my
debt, for
e just and favorable dealing w
th
e Gentleman whose case I recomended to
you, and from whom I fynd by him, he
hath receaved so many Tokens demonstra-
tively of yo
r
respect to my l
re
s in his behalf
as I can not be long sylent from ackno-
ledging yo
r
kindenes therin, and as I acownt
it an ornament t o my Fortune to be
followed
accompanied
w
th
e Affection of such a one as yo
r
self, so
wyll I accompt it a contentment
and
an
and hono
r
to my self, to be
so
fortunate as to requite it
wh
with like measure, according to
e op-
portunity of Tyme and Occasion w
ch
I wyll not
omitt at any Tyme.
Her M
ty
is not well pleased wth their coldnes,
and
nor
w
th
Barnevelts
Incertainty, but I see she is resol-
ved to expect, and so I hold it best.
I have now no more to advertise you nor
troble yow and therfore I end my l
re
abruptly and rest
Your loving and as

f
r
Robert Cecyll
